definition: to apply a treatment/to undertake a therapy
to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out
to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research
diagnosis and treatment based on an overall analysis of the illness and the patient's condition

sentences.english: To evaluate the usability of endoscopy for the diagnosis of rhinorrhea.
sentences.chinese: 评价鼻内窥镜应用于鼻渊辨证施治中的价值。

sentences.english: Clinical general the stroke divides into the internal organs and the channels and collaterals, but dialectical treats.
sentences.chinese: 临床上将中风分为中脏腑和中经络而辨证施治。
医生是施治者，而非刽子手。

sentences.english: Conclusion Tongue diagnosis is an important way to the syndrome differentiation and treatment of traumatological disordesr.
sentences.chinese: 结论舌诊是中医骨伤科辨证施治的重要手段和依据。

sentences.english: Conclusion We can choose Chinese drugs by differentiation of signs for intractable and fatigue angina pectoris.
sentences.chinese: 结论顽固性劳累型心绞痛可以选择中药辨证施治。

sentences.english: To adopt the treatment of TCM Bianzhen Lunzhi to treat the syndrome of hepatic bile stagnation.
sentences.chinese: 针对肝内胆汁郁滞症采用中医辩证施治治疗。

sentences.english: Clinical phases of pathological state and treatment based on differentiation of signs of coronary atherosclerosis.
sentences.chinese: 冠状动脉粥样硬化的病理状态临床分期与辨证施治。

sentences.english: Besides syndrome differentiation, wind-extinguishing herbs are often added to enhance the clinical efficacy.
sentences.chinese: 用药时在辨证施治的基础上加熄风之品疗效更好。

definition: diagnosis and treatment based on an overall analysis of the illness and the patient's condition
correct diagnosis/to prescribe the right cure for an illness/to suit the medicine to the illness
lit. the disease is cured the moment the medicine is taken (idiom)/fig. (of a medical treatment) to give instant results/(of a solution or method) highly effective
interpretation of the cause/onset and process of an illness/pathogenesis
acupuncture and moxibustion/to give or have acupuncture and moxibustion
(TCM) diagnosis based on the patient's pulse/to make such a diagnosis
